DataElement.preferredName: RT Fraction Scheme Referenced Beam DICOM Sequence of Items Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Introduces sequence of treatment beams in current Fraction Group. One or more items shall be included in this sequence.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Fractionation Scheme Referenced Beam Sequence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Dividing the total dose of radiation therapy into several smaller, equal doses delivered over a period of several days._Scheme; an elaborate and systematic plan of action._Something referred to; the object of a reference._A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles._Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:Dividing the total dose of radiation therapy into several smaller, equal doses delivered over a period of several days.:Scheme; an elaborate and systematic plan of action.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
Radiation therapy in which the total dose delivered is divided into several smaller, equal doses delivered over a period of several days.
An elaborate and systematic plan of action.

Property.preferredDefinition: Something referred to; the object of a reference.:A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.:Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

Concepts.definition: Something referred to; the object of a reference.
A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.
A serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/18/19 jk DICOM CDE; Released per qtrly metric review.  11/20/13 created for a Norton CC DICOM RT study. jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: SQ: Text used to describe named areas of the body as an order set of zero to 'n' values referenced by ordinal position starting with 1 as defined in the 2007 DICOM, Part 5, Paragraph 7.5 Nesting of Data Sets. Size of text may be an Explicit Length or variable Undefined Length.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.:A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.
A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 11/20/13 datatype changed to charater to support OCI. jc  2/11/09 released because VD used in NCIA DE to be released.  8/21/07-DICOM SQ value representation type for DICOM which has a variable size

ReferenceDocuments.description: PS 3.3-2011: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM), Part 3: Information Object Definitions

ReferenceDocuments.name: DICOM Condition
ReferenceDocuments.description: Required if Number of Beams (300A,0080) is greater than zero.
